questions.question: …………………….. he is your friend, why doesn’t he talk to you?
…………………… it was a hot afternoon, I felt lethargic.
………………………. he is busy, he finds enough time for his family.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He will do it ……………………… it is dangerous.
questions.description: Even though refers to the past even if refers to the present or future.

questions.question: She went alone ……………………. it was not safe.
questions.description: Either even though or though is possible here. Even though is more emphatic than though.

questions.question: He smiled ……………………… he knew everything.
questions.description: Either as if or as though can be used to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: We will start …………………….. we hear from them.
I won’t leave ……………………. you give me my money back.
questions.description: Unless means the same as if...not...

questions.question: He spent his last years in the village ……………………… he was born.
questions.description: Where means the same as in which.

questions.question: ……………………….. he is a popular actor, his acting skills are questionable.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He neither rose from his seat ……………………. looked at me.
